utilities

Class BitManipulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • utilities.BitManipulation

  • public class BitManipulation
extends java.lang.Object
    The functions included are made for convenient bit manipulation of webId's in the context of the HyPeerWeb.
    Author:
    Craig Jacobson

    • Method Detail

      • calculateSurrogateWebId

        public static int calculateSurrogateWebId(int webId)
        Finds the surrogate for a given webId. A surrogate is defined here as the number who's bit representation has a zero where the webId's leading 1 bit is, for example: if the webId's three the bit representation is 11 then the surrogate is 01.
        Parameters:
        webId - The id to find a surrogate of.
        Returns:
        The webId's surrogate.
        Pre-condition:
        An webId greater than or equal to one (zero does not have a surrogate).
        Post-condition:
        result = webId's surrogate

      • calculateChildWebId

        public static int calculateChildWebId(int parentWebId,
                      int parentHeight)
        Finds the child's webId from the parent's webId. Note that the height of the parent must be one less than that of the child. This method is intended to be called before the addChild method is called.
        Parameters:
        parentWebId - The webId of the parent node.
        parentHeight - The height of the parent node (one less than that of the child node).
        Returns:
        The webId of the child node.
        Pre-condition:
        parentWebId >= 0, parentHeight >= 0, parentWebId <= 0x3FFFFFFF, parentHeight <= 30
        Post-condition:
        result = child's webId

      • calculateChildWebId

        public static int calculateChildWebId(Node parent)
        Convenience method, see calculateChildWebId(int,int).
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node.
        Pre-condition:
        parent != null AND the preconditions for calculateChildWebId(int,int).
        Post-condition:
        See postconditions for calculateChildWebId(int,int).

      • calculateParentWebId

        public static int calculateParentWebId(int childWebId,
                       int childHeight)

      • calculateInsertionPointWebId

        public static int calculateInsertionPointWebId(int lastNodeWebId)
        Calculates the WebId of the insertion point from the WebId of the last node in the HyPeerWeb, also known as the deletion point.
        Parameters:
        lastNodeWebId - The WebId of the last node in the HyPeerWeb.
        Returns:
        The WebId of the insertion point.
        Pre-condition:
        lastNodeWebId >= 0
        Post-condition:
        result = insertionPointWebId

      • isCapNodeWebId

        public static boolean isCapNodeWebId(int webId)
        Tests a webId to see if it is a cap node or not. Note that the given webId is assumed to be the largest node in the web.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId to test.
        Returns:
        True if the webId is a cap node; false otherwise.
        Pre-condition:
        The webId is assumed to be the highest webId in the HyPeerWeb; webId >= 0.
        Post-condition:
        result = (webId is cap node? true: false)

      • calculateWebIdHeight

        public static int calculateWebIdHeight(int webId)
        Calculates the height of the given webId. This is the number of bits from the leading "1" bit to the last bit on the right. Example: 001001100 has a height of 7.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId to find the height of.
        Returns:
        The height of the given webId.
        Pre-condition:
        webId >= 0
        Post-condition:
        result = webId height

      • calculateHighestOneBitMask

        public static int calculateHighestOneBitMask(int number)
        Calculates a bit mask for the highest "1" bit in the number given.
        Parameters:
        number - The number to create a bit mask with.
        Returns:
        The highest one bit mask.
        Pre-condition:
        number >= 0
        Post-condition:
        result = highestOneBitMask

      • calculateLowestOneBitMask

        public static int calculateLowestOneBitMask(int number)
        Calculates a bit mask for the lowest "1" bit in the number given.
        Parameters:
        number - The number to create a bit mask with.
        Returns:
        The lowest one bit mask.
        Pre-condition:
        number >= 0
        Post-condition:
        result = lowestOneBitMask

      • calculateNextJumpWebId

        public static int calculateNextJumpWebId(int currentWebId,
                         int destinationWebId)
        Calculates the next jump to make in the HyPeerWeb.
        Parameters:
        currentWebId - The webId of the node you are currently at.
        destinationWebId - The webId of the node you want to get to.
        Returns:
        The next jump in the web that needs to be made.
        Pre-condition:
        Both inputs are non-negative integers.
        Post-condition:
        The webId of the next node to jump to.

      • calculateBroadcastWebIds

        public static int[] calculateBroadcastWebIds(int webId,
                             int height)
        Calculates all of the neighbors you should broadcast to.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId of the node to broadcast from.
        height - The height of the node to broadcast from.
        Pre-condition:
        Valid webId and height >= 0; also, height < 32. Note that height is only necessary if webId == 0. Also, the broadcast algorithm assumes that the broadcast started at node zero, otherwise not all nodes will be broadcasted to.
        Post-condition:
        An integer array of all of the nodes' webIds to broadcast to. Arranged in ascending order.
